skill.name: Agent Generation
skill.description: This skill provides knowledge for generating effective Claude Code agents tailored to specific projects. It is used internally by the agent-team-creator plugin when analyzing codebases and creating specialized agent teams. Contains templates, best practices, and patterns for writing project-aware agents.

skill.author: Cpicon

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing markdown files with templates and guidance for generating Claude Code agents. No executable code, no network calls, no file system access beyond reading documentation. Contains only conceptual content for agent design.

content.value_statement: Creating effective Claude Code agents requires deep project knowledge. This skill provides templates and patterns to generate project-aware agents tailored to your specific codebase, tech stack, and architecture.
actual_capabilities: Provides templates for tech-stack, architecture, domain, testing, and DevOps expert agents
Contains analysis patterns for identifying project type, frameworks, and conventions
Includes trigger condition templates for agent activation
Defines color coding and tool permissions for generated agents
limitations: Does not execute any code or modify files automatically
Only provides guidance and templates for manual agent creation
Requires manual population of project-specific placeholders
Does not integrate directly with Claude Code interface

use_cases.title: Standardize team agents
use_cases.description: Create consistent expert agents for your codebase that all team members can use

use_cases.title: Build agent generators
use_cases.description: Use templates to build tools that automatically generate specialized agents

use_cases.title: Design multi-agent systems
use_cases.description: Architect teams of complementary AI agents with distinct focus areas

prompt_templates.title: Create tech expert
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a tech-stack expert agent for a Next.js project. Use the tech-stack template. Include React patterns, hooks usage, and state management conventions specific to the project.

prompt_templates.title: Design architecture guide
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate an architecture expert agent using the architecture template. Include directory structure, module boundaries, and naming conventions from the analysis patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Build domain specialist
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a domain expert agent for user management and authentication. Use the domain template. Include entities, relationships, and business rules.

prompt_templates.title: Compose testing specialist
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a testing specialist agent for a project using Jest and React Testing Library. Include fixture locations and mocking patterns.

output_examples.input: Create a React expert agent for my Next.js project
output: Trigger conditions: React patterns, hooks, Next.js features, component architecture
System prompt: Expert on myproject React development with tech stack, key directories, and conventions
Tools: Glob, Grep, Read, Edit, Write, Bash, LS, Task, WebFetch, WebSearch

best_practices: Always populate templates with actual project file paths and framework names instead of generic placeholders
Define distinct, non-overlapping trigger conditions for each agent to prevent conflicts
Include specific code examples and pattern references from your actual codebase
anti_patterns: Using generic templates without project-specific context makes agents less effective
Overlapping trigger conditions cause confusion about which agent should respond
Omitting real file paths prevents agents from providing contextual guidance

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Templates are designed for Claude Code agent definitions.

faq.question: What project sizes work best?
faq.answer: Templates scale from simple 2-3 agent teams for small projects to 5-8 agents for complex monorepos.

faq.question: Can I combine agents?
faq.answer: Yes. Each agent has distinct triggers. Ensure triggers do not overlap for best results.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This skill contains only documentation. No code execution, file access, or network calls occur.

faq.question: Why are my generated agents not working?
faq.answer: Check that all template placeholders like project names and file paths are populated with real values.

faq.question: How is this different from custom instructions?
faq.answer: This skill provides structured templates for creating multiple specialized agents with defined roles.
